NavigationDestination.summary: NOTE Experimental The NavigationDestination interface of the {{domxref("Navigation API", "Navigation API", "", "nocode")}} represents the destination being navigated to in the current navigation.

remarks.para: It is accessed via the property.

-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer
-Navigation API live demo (view demo source)

NavigationDestinationGetState.summary:
NOTE Experimental The getState() method of the
interface returns a clone of the developer-supplied state associated with the destination , or navigation operation (e.g., ) as appropriate.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer
-Methods that allow state to be updated â€” , , and

NavigationDestinationGetState.returns: A value representing the state. This can be any type.If no state is defined, it returns undefined.

NavigationDestinationId.summary:
NOTE Experimental The id read-only property of the
interface returns the value of the destination if the is traverse, or an empty string otherwise.

remarks.para: The id is a unique, UA-generated value that always represents the history entry, useful to correlate a history entry with an external resource such as a storage cache.

-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigationDestinationId.value: A string representing the id of the destination , or an empty string.

NavigationDestinationIndex.summary:
NOTE Experimental The index read-only property of the
interface returns the value of the destination if the is traverse, or -1 otherwise.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigationDestinationIndex.value: A number representing the index of the destination , or -1.

NavigationDestinationKey.summary:
NOTE Experimental The key read-only property of the
interface returns the value of the destination if the is traverse, or an empty string otherwise.

remarks.para: The key is a unique, UA-generated value that represents the history entry's slot in the history entries list, used to navigate to this place in the history via . It will be reused by other entries that replace the entry in the list (i.e., if the is replace).

-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigationDestinationKey.value: A string representing the key of the destination , or an empty string.

NavigationDestinationSameDocument.summary:
NOTE Experimental The sameDocument read-only property of the
interface returns true if the navigation is to the same document as the current value, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: This is useful for checking whether the navigation will be same-document or cross-document.

-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigationDestinationUrl.summary:
NOTE Experimental The url read-only property of the
interface returns the URL being navigated to.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer
